event_name: Gulf War (Iraq invades Kuwait; coalition conflict)
description: Iraq’s invasion of Kuwait and subsequent coalition military action disrupted supply expectations and drove large oil price volatility.
source: General reference (curate with EIA/OPEC/major news archive)
source_name: General reference (curate with EIA/OPEC/major news archive)

description: Regional financial crisis reduced demand growth expectations across emerging markets, pressuring crude prices.
Economic slowdown reduced demand outlook; prices weakened amid lower growth expectations.
Geopolitical risk premium increased with invasion and conflict uncertainty affecting supply expectations.
source: General reference (curate with EIA/OPEC/major news archive)
source_name: General reference (curate with EIA/OPEC/major news archive)

description: Financial crisis led to sharp contraction in economic activity and oil demand; major price collapse and volatility regime shift.

event_name: Rapid US shale production growth (supply expansion)
description: Rising US tight oil production expanded non-OPEC supply, altering the supply curve and contributing to later market rebalancing dynamics.
source: General reference (curate with EIA production data)
source_name: General reference (curate with EIA production data)

description: Regional unrest and Libya’s supply outage tightened supply and elevated risk premiums, supporting higher prices.

event_name: OPEC shifts to market-share strategy (no production cut)
description: OPEC’s decision to avoid cutting output amid rising US shale supply contributed to a prolonged oil price downturn.
source: General reference (curate with OPEC communiqués / EIA)
source_name: General reference (curate with OPEC communiqués / EIA)

description: OPEC and partners coordinated cuts to rebalance markets, supporting a recovery and shifting price dynamics.

event_name: Iran sanctions tightening (US withdrawal from JCPOA)
description: Sanctions tightened expected supply from Iran, affecting risk premia and price dynamics amid global demand uncertainties.
Pandemic restrictions triggered an unprecedented collapse in mobility and oil demand, causing extreme volatility and regime change.

event_name: OPEC+ price war & subsequent historic cuts
description: Breakdown and renegotiation of OPEC+ cooperation amplified price collapse; later record cuts helped stabilize markets.
source: General reference (curate with OPEC statements / news archive)
source_name: General reference (curate with OPEC statements / news archive)

event_name: Russia–Ukraine war; sanctions and supply re-routing
description: Invasion and subsequent sanctions increased supply risk and reshaped trade flows, triggering large price spikes and volatility.
source: General reference (curate with IEA/EIA/major news archive)
source_name: General reference (curate with IEA/EIA/major news archive)

description: Additional voluntary cuts aimed to support prices amid macro uncertainty, influencing price level and volatility.
